intro: Aleuritia farinosa subsp. exigua, commonly known as the small-flowered snowbell, is a shrub native to East Asia. It is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that appear in early spring. The plant has smooth, grayish bark and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
